help.title: Bell UH-1H Iroquois
help.line: Max take-off weight 9,500lbs
Engine Start
1. The s key toggles the turbine APU generators
2. The s key also initiated the turbine starters
keep pressed for 3 seconds until starter full engaged
3. The UH-1H is equiped with a 1,400 shp (1,000 kW) Lycoming T53-L-13 engine
Normal Flight Mode
1. Adjust rotor pitch using the throttle collective
2. Adjust Pitch and Roll using yoke cyclic
3. Adjust Yaw using rudder peddles
Trim
1. At desired attitude press the home key and imediatley release cyclic
Engine off Flight
Upon detection of engine failure
1. The pilots MUST reduce the throttle collective to maximise rotor rpm's.
3. The pilot should endeavour to identify a suitable landing zone
4. Use of the throttle collective to flair upon landing is advised, push throttle collective forward imediateley on touch-down
Slide Door Gunner
In this position the pilot will fly the helicopter in a straight direction maintaining the height above ground/sea level
